short_description: Computes the Levenshtein distance between words in target column and each source column
long_description: Computes the Levenshtein distance between words in target column and each source column. User can specify a maximum distance.  See implementation at http://www.merriampark.com/ld.htm

argument_clauses.name: TargetColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the target text.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the target text.

argument_clauses.name: Source
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input columns that contain the source text.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input columns that contain the source text.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: Threshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the value that determines whether to return the Levenshtein distance for a source-target pair. The threshold must a positive integer. The function returns the Levenshtein distance for a pair if it is less than or equal to threshold; otherwise, the function returns -1. By default, the function returns the Levenshtein distance of every pair.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the value that determines whether to return the Levenshtein distance for a source-target pair. The threshold must a positive integer. The function returns the Levenshtein distance for a pair if it is less than or equal to threshold; otherwise, the function returns -1. By default, the function returns the Levenshtein distance of every pair.

argument_clauses.name: OutputColumnName
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output column that contains the Levenshtein distance for a source-target pair. The default value is 'distance'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the output column that contains the Levenshtein distance for a source-target pair. The default value is 'distance'.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTargetColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output column that contains the compared target text. The default value is 'target'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the output column that contains the compared target text. The default value is 'target'.

argument_clauses.name: PrintSourceColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output column that contains the compared source text. The default value is 'source'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the output column that contains the compared source text. The default value is 'source'.
